lines.text: Poor 'ittle Omar! Nobody 'oves 'ou but 'ou's 'ittle Muvver.

[Looking at Amy's Father]
Dis guy's some swell; he flashes a cook.
[Speaking to Amy]
Say Kiddo! We wants to be friends.
I am utterly fatigued. You will oblige me by leaving.

[Sarcastically]
Oh girls! Miss Asterbilt is fat-i-goo-ed; we'll jest leave our cards.
Thief! Those are our towels!
My laundry's late - and - I-I-oh well, you know, cleanliness is next to godliness.
I advise you to be less clean and more honest.

[Throwing dice]
Hop an' get 'em! Read 'em an' weep!
Them bones is loaded.
I'll get even wid youse!
Gee mister, you saved me from the jug! Slip me your mitt!
Gee! Dis bohunk mus' be a safe-cracker!
Zowie! We'll frame this bird for a crap game!
I'll be takin' none of yer insinuatin', you little gafiltafish!
I'm some bonehead! The kids in the alley are miles ahead of me in school.
Let's show Snowball how to shake the shimmy!
Say kid, you sure shake a mean hoof.
And take it from me Dish, dere's no flies on you.
What's de big idea? You said I wuz jest to tease de yid.
[Amy gives him a dollar bill]
Only one caser fer gittin' booted down de stairs?
Amy, do you realize that this makes us crooks?
Not if we don't get caught.

[writing in his notebook]
Pride prompts me to abandon Amy to her fate - but my curiosity to see to what limits of vulgarity she will descend, keeps me here.

[as she's opening the combination to her grandfather's safe]
How do you know the combination?

[pauses for a moment]
I was nurse maid to the young dame's sparklers.
Mr. Turner, words seem futile. I can only hope you will allow me to vindicate fully your honor.
I can never forgive Alexander Guthrie!
But won't you forgive... Peter Cooper?
